citation.abstract: Neutral chloromethylpalladium(ii) complexes, [Pd(Cl)(CH3)(L)] () with ligands κ(2)-N^S-2-((3,5-di-tert-butyl-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)-6-(phenylthiomethyl)pyridine (), κ(2)-N^S-2-((3,5-dimethyl-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)-6-(phenylthiomethyl)pyridine (), κ(2)-N^Se-2-((3,5-di-tert-butyl-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)-6-(phenylselanylmethyl)pyridine (), κ(2)-N^Se-2-((3,5-dimethyl-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)-6-(phenylselanylmethyl)pyridine (), and κ(2)-N^N-2-((3,5-dimethyl-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)-6-(phenoxymethyl)pyridine () have been synthesised and characterised by various spectroscopic techniques. Ligands exhibit Npy^S/Se bidentate coordination whereas shows an Npy^Npz bidentate coordination mode in their corresponding neutral palladium complexes. Abstraction of chloride in neutral palladium complexes with NaBAr4 (BAr4 = tetrakis[3,5-bis(trifluoromethyl)-phenyl]borate) resulted in the formation of the cationic palladium complexes , in which adopt a tridentate Npz^Npy^X (X = S or Se) coordination mode in their respective cationic palladium complexes () whilst in complex adopts a Npy^Npz bidentate coordination mode and the palladium centre is stabilized by the weakly coordinating acetonitrile. Compounds readily undergo CO insertion into the Pd-CH3 bond to form Pd-acyl that determines their ability to catalyse CO/ethylene copolymerisation to polyketones.
citation.journal: Dalton Transactions: An International Journal of Inorganic Chemistry
citation.title: Effect of chalcogens on CO insertion into the palladium-methyl bond of [(N^N^X)Pd(CH3)]+ (X = O, S, Se) and on CO/ethylene copolymerisation
